title: 'Horrific': US slams mob violence on Hindu worker in Bangladesh; demands action
content: The US State Department has strongly condemned the "horrific" mob killing of Hindu garment worker Dipu Chandra Das in Bangladesh, demanding an unequivocal stand against religious hatred.  This statement follows growing concerns over attacks on minority communities. US lawmakers have also voiced outrage, urging condemnation of such bigotry. The incident highlights the precarious situation for religious minorities amid political shifts.

title: Twist in court: 2nd husband testifies for 1st; woman loses 17-year old domestic violence case
content: A 17-year-old domestic violence case took an unexpected turn when a woman's current husband testified, confirming her second marriage. This revelation led a Borivli court to rule she was no longer entitled to maintenance from her ex-husband, effectively ending her claim for protection and monetary relief initiated in 2009.

title: 'If Kyiv doesn't want peace …': Putin's big warning ahead of Zelenskyy-Trump meet
content: Russian President Putin issued a stark warning to Ukraine, stating Russia will achieve its military goals if peace isn't pursued.  He highlighted progress on a border buffer zone and claimed advances in Donbass and Zaporozhye.  Meanwhile, President Zelenskyy emphasized that occupied territories and the nuclear plant are "red lines" ahead of his US meeting, prioritizing security guarantees.

title: West Bengal: Humayun Kabir's son 'assualts' cop in Murshidabad; detained
content: Golam Nabi Azad, son of Janata Unnayan Party chief Humayun Kabir, was arrested in Murshidabad for allegedly assaulting a police officer at his family residence. The officer filed a complaint after Azad reportedly objected to his presence and then assaulted him. Kabir claims the arrest is politically motivated by the TMC.

title: Battle of the Sexes: How Sabalenka–Kyrgios match strips politics from a historic feminist moment
content: Tennis legend Billie Jean King distinguishes the upcoming "Battle of the Sexes" exhibition between Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios from her historic 1973 match. King emphasizes her original contest was pivotal for social change and women's rights, a stark contrast to the current event, which she deems apolitical and primarily for entertainment and profit, questioning its benefit to women's tennis.

title: Ex-Tesla's AI director Andrej Karpathy warns programmers of falling behind
content: Tesla's ex-AI chief, Andrej Karpathy, warns software engineers face a seismic shift as AI reshapes coding. He admits feeling behind, highlighting a new 'programmable layer' of AI tools. While some studies show mixed productivity gains, industry leaders like Google and Anthropic remain optimistic about AI's role in development.

title: 'Cong all united': Digvijaya after RSS remark; condemns BJP's 'attempts to sow discord'
content: Digvijaya Singh asserted Congress unity amidst a BJP controversy over his praise for the RSS's organizational strength. He accused the BJP of trying to divide the Nehru-Gandhi family, emphasizing the party's solidarity. Singh clarified his stance, stating his opposition to the RSS and PM Modi while supporting a strong organizational framework.

title: 'It was awful stuff': Former cricket legend tears into modern batting after Boxing Day Test
content: Geoffrey Boycott attributed England's Boxing Day Test victory to superior fundamentals rather than luck, criticizing modern batting development. He argued that white-ball dominance and flat pitches hinder batsmen's ability to handle moving balls on seaming surfaces, a problem exacerbated by reduced County cricket. Boycott also highlighted Australia's ordinary batting, calling their dismissals "shockers" and the overall display "awful stuff."

title: How B'luru techie became Andhra’s ‘lady don’; arrested for supplying 'Sheelavathi strain'
content: Nathavaram police have arrested eight individuals, including a Bengaluru software engineer, for smuggling high-quality Sheelavathi strain cannabis from Narsipatnam to Tamil Nadu and Sri Lanka. The operation, led by 'lady don' Gade Renuka, involved procuring ganja from Odisha and distributing it, marking a potential first for smuggling to Sri Lanka via the Andhra-Odisha border.

title: AirPods experiment: Apple tested two colours and then dropped them; here’s why
content: New leaks reveal Apple experimented with bright pink and yellow AirPods charging cases in 2016, abandoning them for the iconic white design. This follows previous reports of other color explorations. The recently launched AirPods Pro 3, however, introduce significant upgrades including a heart rate sensor and improved noise cancellation.

title: 'Most guests were Hindus': UP woman on Bajrang Dal's b'day disruption over 'love jihad'
content: Right-wing activists disrupted a birthday party in Bareilly, falsely accusing two Muslim guests of "love jihad" despite most attendees being Hindu. Police booked the Muslim guests and a cafe staffer for breach of peace, though an inquiry found no wrongdoing by the students. The victim stated the "love jihad" claim was unfounded.

title: 'Thought I was next Steve Jobs': Google founder shares lesson from early days
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin shared a key lesson learned from the Google Glass failure, advising entrepreneurs to fully develop their ideas before public stunts. He admitted to rushing commercialization and aiming for a "Steve Jobs moment" prematurely.

title: Hounded after wife's suicide, Bengaluru man drives 1000 km to kill self
content: In a heart-wrenching incident, Suraj Shivanna from Bengaluru succumbed to despair and ended his life in a Nagpur hotel, mere days after his wife's unfortunate passing. Grappling with accusations of dowry harassment and the impending strain from his in-laws, Suraj and his relatives were attempting to escape when the incident occurred.

title: Brigitte Bardot, French film icon, passes away at 91
content: Legendary French figure Brigitte Bardot, revered as a global sex symbol and fierce advocate for animal rights, has died at the age of 91. She burst onto the scene in 'And God Created Woman,' captivating audiences before shifting her focus entirely to animal welfare, which ultimately earned her France’s highest accolades.

title: 'Congress not just a party, but voice of India's soul': Rahul on party's foundation day
content: On the Indian National Congress's 140th Foundation Day, Rahul Gandhi declared the party as "the voice of India’s soul," that is committed to the weak, the deprived and hardworking people. He extended greetings, paid tribute to the party's legacy of winning freedom and strengthening democratic values, and resolved to fight injustice.

title: Year ender 2025: How women became the X-factor of the year
content: In 2025, women emerged as the decisive force, shaping outcomes across various spheres. From Operation Sindoor's symbolic and active response to terror, to women voters determining Bihar's fate, their influence was undeniable. New women leaders reshaped global politics, athletes dominated sports, and Roshni Nadar redefined economic power, marking a year of profound change.

title: 'Karnataka not Rahul Gandhi's colony': BJP slams Cong's Venugopal over eviction row
content: Karnataka BJP leader R Ashoka has slammed Congress general secretary K C Venugopal for his remarks on the Bengaluru demolition drive, accusing him of interfering in state administration. Ashoka questioned Venugopal's authority and highlighted alleged hypocrisy regarding waste dumping from Kerala.

title: Indian wine exports double from last year; Alphonso, jamun & more flavours
content: India's wine exports are surging, with fruit-based wines gaining traction alongside traditional grape varieties. A recent shipment of jamun wine to the US marks a significant milestone, as domestic consumption remains muted. While grape wines lead exports, non-grape varieties like mango and apple wines are also finding international markets, though producers face challenges with competitiveness and sustained demand.

title: Watch: Men in high-speed cars perform deadly stunts; Delhi Police responds
content: A group of men was captured on video performing reckless stunts and high-speed racing on Delhi streets, swerving through traffic and standing out of car sunroofs. The footage, shared widely on social media, prompted a response from Delhi Police, who have been informed and are verifying the video to identify the individuals involved.

title: 'Dhurandhar'Day 24 vs 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Teri Tu Mera' box office collection day 4
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its box office dominance, reaching Rs 677.31 crore by its 24th day. The film surpassed the Sunday collection of 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Teri Tu Mera,' which earned Rs 1.88 crore on its fourth day, bringing its total to Rs 20.38 crore.

title: Pakistan kabaddi player wears Indian jersey, waves tricolour; banned indefinitely
content: Pakistan international kabaddi player Ubaidullah Rajput has been indefinitely banned by the Pakistan Kabaddi Federation for playing for an Indian team in a private tournament in Bahrain without a no-objection certificate. Rajput claimed it was a misunderstanding, but the federation cited his participation and representation of an Indian team as violations.

title: Is NEET PG student data out for sale? Here is what we know so far
content: Recent media reports suggest NEET PG 2025 candidates’ personal data—including names, contact details, scores, and ranks—may be circulating online and sold to private agents. NBEMS denies any breach at its end and has submitted a report to the Health Ministry. Aspirants face unsolicited calls, stress, and privacy concerns, highlighting the urgent need for transparency and stronger safeguards in the counselling process.

title: Ashes: Root joins Sachin, Ponting, Lara in elite list; becomes 9th batter to achieve this feat
content: Root, who had never scored a century on Australian soil, finally broke the curse as he scored an unbeaten 138 in the first innings of the second Ashes 2025-26 Test at Brisbane.

title: In search of Bharatiya 'porichoy': Will the Matua–Namasudras rewrite 'poriborton' in Bengal elections?
content: Why the Matua-Namasudra community views politics the way it does becomes clearer when one looks beyond electoral arithmetic, beyond BJP versus Trinamool Congress (TMC), and even before the creation of Bangladesh. The Matua movement, by the early twentieth century, had become as much a social force as a religious one.

title: New Year's in Bengaluru: Parties must end by 1am; check rules
content: Bengaluru police have mandated that New Year's Eve celebrations at commercial establishments must conclude by 1 am. Venues are prohibited from exceeding their holding capacity and must close entry once full, with no waiting allowed outside. Offensive songs and slogans are banned, and security measures including screening and fire safety are compulsory.

title: Vijay Hazare Trophy: Virat Kohli's next match for Delhi - All you need to know
content: Virat Kohli made a sensational return to domestic cricket in the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025–26, scoring 208 runs in his first two matches for Delhi. He became the fastest to 16,000 List A runs with a century against Andhra and followed it with a half-century and two catches against Gujarat.

title: Dehradun racial abuse: Tripura student stabbed to death; was called ‘chinki’, ‘momo’
content: A 24-year-old MBA student from Tripura, Anjel Chakma, tragically died in Dehradun after a brutal stabbing, reportedly triggered by racial abuse. He was attacked on December 9th. The incident has sparked outrage and calls for justice, with authorities intensifying efforts to apprehend the main absconding accused.

title: Watch: 3 men harass woman rider for several kilometres in Bengaluru
content: Though an official X post, the SG Palya police station stated on Saturday that it had registered an FIR, arrested and remanded three men to judicial custody, who, according to a witness, were harassing a girl for several kilometres on a main road. According to the on-site witness, who recorded a video as evidence, the incident occurred before 10 pm.

title: First election since 2021 coup: Myanmar is voting after 5 years amid civil war
content: Myanmar is holding its first general election since the 2021 military coup, which the junta claims restores democracy. Critics, however, view it as a sham to legitimize military rule amid a brutal civil war. With major opposition parties banned and leaders jailed, the election is highly contentious, lacking genuine competition and free expression.

title: Decoded: Barron Trump's friendship with Andrew Tate
content: The focus on Barron Trump followed reporting that he had been in contact with Justin Waller, a Texas-based influencer who presents himself as a close confidant of Andrew and Tristan Tate. Waller has described himself as a “third brother” to the Tates, a phrase meant to signal loyalty rather than family ties. According to his own accounts, he has socialised with Barron and spoken to him regularly, including on personal matters such as dating and navigating public life.

title: 'We can learn': Tharoor’s 'discipline' retort to Digvijaya Singh’s RSS praise
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor offered a measured response to Digvijaya Singh's praise for the RSS's organizational strength, emphasizing the need for internal discipline. While acknowledging Singh as a friend, Tharoor stated the party can learn from its own 140-year history. Other Congress leaders sharply criticized the RSS, highlighting ideological differences.

title: Indian students placing their bets on destinations beyond the Big 4: Here’s why
content: Indian students are still looking abroad, but they are choosing differently. The US, UK, Canada and Australia now come with higher costs, stricter visa checks and too many unknowns. So many are turning to places that feel more workable—Germany for affordability, New Zealand for stability, and the UAE for proximity and job links. It is study abroad, with fewer surprises.

title: President Murmu takes submarine sortie at Karwar naval base - see pics
content: President Droupadi Murmu experienced a submarine sortie aboard the INS Vaghsheer, an indigenous Kalvari class submarine, at the Karwar naval base. Accompanied by Chief of Naval Staff Admiral Dinesh K. Tripathi, this marks the second presidential submarine journey, following APJ Abdul Kalam.

title: UP club brawl: Woman attacked with 'beer' bottle during Christmas celebration
content: A Christmas night celebration turned violent in Bareilly when a woman was allegedly struck on the head with a glass bottle during an argument over a table at a club. The incident, captured on video, saw the woman assaulted by a group of men. Police have registered an FIR and are reviewing CCTV footage to apprehend the accused.

title: Your wallet isn’t as clean as you think: What a microbiologist found living on money
content: Microbiologist Dr. Shweta revealed the hidden fungal colonies thriving on money by culturing it in a lab.  Her findings highlight how everyday cash, passed through many hands, becomes a breeding ground for microbes.  This underscores the importance of diligent hand hygiene to prevent the spread of potential infections.

title: Ratan Tata's 88 birth anniversary: Politicians, industrialists pay tributes
content: India remembered Ratan Tata on his 88th birth anniversary with tributes from political leaders and industrialists. Tata Trusts highlighted his strategic philanthropic approach, while leaders praised his integrity, compassion, and role in reshaping Indian enterprise. His legacy of innovation, trust, and nation-building continues to inspire.

title: Hands tied, face covered: Why did a gangster's Pune civic polls nomination bid fail?
content: Arrested gangster Bandu Andekar and two relatives attempted to file nomination papers for the PMC polls but were unsuccessful due to missing documents. Despite court permission and police escort, they couldn't complete the process, causing disruptions for other candidates.

title: Paragliding pilot dies during takeoff at Bir Billing; tourist survives
content: A tandem paragliding pilot died in a crash shortly after takeoff at Bir Billing, marking the third fatality this year. The incident has raised concerns about safety standards and pilot working conditions. An inquiry is underway, with authorities emphasizing strict adherence to SOPs and passenger screening.

title: How India's economy defied odds in 2025 — but external shocks left a mark
content: India's economy demonstrated remarkable resilience in 2025, achieving 8.2% GDP growth amidst global trade wars and tariffs. A rare 'Goldilocks' phase of low inflation and accommodative monetary policy, coupled with GST 2.0 and tax relief, bolstered domestic demand. The year concluded with mixed stock market trends,  record FIIs, rupee pressure and tariffs highlighting ongoing global uncertainties.

title: 'Nothing will happen to me': BJP corporator's husband accused of assault; arrested after viral video
content: The husband of a BJP corporator in Satna district has been booked for threatening and misbehaving with a woman. A viral video purportedly shows him threatening the woman, who claims he also made objectionable demands. Police have registered a case and apprehended the accused.

title: Rs 1.07 cr for a catch! Fan takes one-handed blinder, steals the show - Watch
content: Ryan Rickelton's stunning 113 went in vain as MI Cape Town fell short by 15 runs in a high-scoring SA20 opener. Durban's Super Giants posted a record 232/5, powered by Devon Conway's 64, before Ethan Bosch's crucial wickets sealed the win.

title: Will Earth really switch to 25 hours days as its rotation slowing down
content: Earth's days are slowly getting longer. This change is driven by the Moon's gravity and shifts in Earth's mass due to melting ice and rising seas. Scientists use advanced tools to measure these tiny shifts. A 25-hour day is a distant future event, taking millions of years. The current changes are imperceptible.

title: Akum Pharma’s Finance chief Rajkumar Bafna resigns citing pollution in Delhi
content: This is probably the first public instance that the senior management personnel of a listed company has cited pollution in Delhi NCR as the reason behind resignation

title: Congress scrambles to give political cover to Mattathur Grama Panchayat ward members who ‘voted for BJP’
content: Under fire from Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan for the “embarrassing political volte-face,” Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan denied that any Congress worker had defected to the BJP

title: BJP seeks longer Assembly session to discuss Telangana farmers’ issues, governance concerns
content: Party says key matters, including agriculture, irrigation and urban development, need detailed debate

title: Kerala State Electricity Board nod for ₹6,478.41 crore plan outlay for 2026-27
content: This includes an outlay of ₹848.79 crore for power generation, ₹1,175.48 crore for transmission and ₹1,669 crore for power distribution side

title: Nagapattinam’s deltaic coast caught in ‘silky crisis’ with sinking shores
content: The coastlines of Vellapallam, Pushpavanam, and Vanavan Mahadevi are being swallowed by a treacherous silky clay that makes the simple act of launching a boat a daily struggle

title: TMC slams EC for 'forcing' elderly people, PWDs to turn up at SIR hearing camps
content: TMC MP Partha Bhowmik alleged that the ECI has summoned elderly and ailing persons who were categorised "unmapped" due to some discrepancies in their enumeration forms

title: Punjab BJP chief Sunil Jakhar targets AAP over special Assembly session
content: Dubbing the Mann government as an “event management” company, Punjab BJP Chief has taken a hit against AAP for misleading the poor with special  assembly session

title: Mumbai civic polls: Congress and Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi seal alliance
content: Congress will contest more than 150 seats, while VBA will compete in 62; some seats will be allocated to Rashtriya Samaj Paksha and RPI (Gavai)

title: CPI(M) veteran K.M. Sudhakaran passes away
content: Sudhakaran was a member of the party’s State committee for 35 years and served as the State treasurer of CITU

title: ‘Misleading and unscientific,’ says IMA in response to Minister’s nod for Ayurvedic doctors to perform surgeries
content: On December 23, Health Minister gave his nod for Ayurverdic doctors, who completed PG courses in surgical studies, to perform select surgeries, and called this a step in the direction of integrating Indian traditional medicine with modern treatment methods

title: Consensus reached with Sena on 207 of 227 BMC seats, says Mumbai BJP chief Satam
content: The BJP and Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena will contest the polls in the metropolis, scheduled for January 15, jointly. The Mahayuti also comprises the Nationalist Congress Party of Ajit Pawar

title: Congress positioned India in global stage: Ministers Ponnam, Vivek and Azhar
content: Ponnam Prabhakar alleged the Centre had reneged on its 2014 promise to expand the scheme to urban areas and instead diluted it by imposing a 60:40 funding pattern on States, thereby shifting the financial burden

title: JUP chief Humayun Kabir's son detained in Bengal’s Murshidabad for assaulting policeman
content: Humayun Kabir alleged that he was being targeted by the police at the behest of the Trinamool Congress.

title: Karbi Anglong violence: Mobile net services restored in Assam districts as situation improves, say Officials
content: Two persons were killed and over 170 people sustained injuries, mostly security personnel, in violence in parts of West Karbi Anglong district last week

title: Sigachi Industries’ CEO arrested six months after blast which killed over 50
content: The arrest followed an investigation carried out by the Patancheru police of Sangareddy district, who examined the circumstances leading to the explosion at the industrial unit

title: Kerala BJP councillor and former DGP R. Sreelekha demands CPI(M) MLA V.K. Prasanth to vacate office, MLA refuses
content: After the issue blew up,  Sreelekha met Prasanth at his office. She says she had only made a friendly request considering the inadequacies of space allotted for the Sasthamangalam councillor in the same building

title: Kerala CPI(M) uses Bengaluru “anti-Muslim” demolition drive to ideologically equate Congress with Sangh Parivar
content: AICC general secretary K.C. Venugopal posted on X that he spoke to Shivakumar and conveyed the AICC’s serious concern that such actions should have been undertaken with far greater caution, sensitivity, and compassion, keeping the human impact at centre

title: Scientists seek clarification from Collector regarding issuance of NoC for drilling activities in Krishna
content: A Hyderabad-based group of scientists sought clarifications from District Collector on risks associated with hydraulic fracturing and allied drilling activities in the Krishna delta

title: New security camp set up in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur to curb Maoist activity, facilitate development
content: The camp will serve as a forward operating base (FOB) for the 7th battalion of the Chhattisgarh Armed Force (CAF)

title: With 97% drop in cases, India to eradicate malaria in short time: Amit Shah
content: The Union Home Minister told doctors the efforts they are taking should be aligned with this infrastructure and scheme to ensure better results

title: WCC slams Kerala government over molestation case against filmmaker Kunhi Muhammed
content: The outfit alleges in an FB post that though the survivor had sent a letter detailing the incident to the Chief Minister, his office did not issue any direct response despite taking certain steps subsequently

title: 150-feet statue of Ardhanarisvara to come up in Srisailam
content: The temple administration has decided statue will be built after taking suggestions and recommendations from experts in Vedas and architecture

title: Sharif Osman Hadi murder case: Two suspects fled to India, claim Bangladesh police
content: “The suspects, Faisal Karim Masud and Alamgir Sheikh, crossed into Meghalaya with the help of local associates,” Additional Police Commissioner (Crime and Operations) of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police (DMP) said

title: Open Merit students cancel Srinagar protest after NC’s Ruhullah, PDP’s Parra, Iltija ‘placed under house arrest’
content: “Today’s sit-in cum meet-up on unfair reservation policy stands cancelled due to circumstances beyond our control. We urge all students to remain calm. Students are advised to return safely to their hostels, libraries, or homes,” says spokesman of Open Merit Students Association J&K

title: 140th Foundation day: Congress is an ideology and ideologies never die, says Mallikarjun Kharge
content: Rahul Gandhi said the Congress is not just a political party, but the voice of India’s soul that has stood with every weak, deprived and hardworking person

title: Jairam Ramesh questions Environment Minister; claims Aravalli redefinition will fragment it
content: In a letter, the Congress leader said there are understandably widespread concerns with the redefinition of the Aravalli Hills that restrict them to landforms having an elevation of 100 metres or more

title: NABARD pegs credit potential for Cuddalore district at ₹27,434.05 crore
content: “PLP for district, which evolved out of consultations with officials at Block, District, and State-level departments in government, banks, and NGOs, also reflected national priorities of Government of India to scale up lending to various sectors of the economy,” says Cuddalore Collector

title: ECI flags technical issue in 2002 rolls, halts hearings for ‘unmapped’ electors in Bengal
content: The Chief Electoral Officer of State issued a directive stating that incomplete conversion of the 2002 electoral rolls from PDF to CSV format has caused linkage failures in the booth-level officer app for some electors

title: Mann Ki Baat: World looking at India with great hope due to ‘youth power’, says PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister said answer to this curiosity of the youth is the 'Viksit Bharat Young Leaders Dialogue', whose first edition was held last year.

title: Three Tamil Nadu fishermen arrested by Sri Lankan Navy
content: Police said the seized trawler was among the 335 mechanised boats which left Mandapam fishing jetty on Saturday

title: President Murmu undertakes submarine sortie at Karwar naval base
content: Droupadi Murmu became the second President to undertake a submarine sortie. In February, 2006, APJ Abdul Kalam became the first president to experience a submarine sortie

title: Congress’s organisational decay fertilises the BJP in Kerala: Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Eight Congress ward members enable the BJP’s ascendancy to power in the Mattanoor Grama Panchayat in Thrissur. Mr Vijayan says “Mattanur model” is portentous for secular and progressive Kerala

title: Over 13 lakh people benefited from 'Nalam Kakkum Stalin' health camps: T.N. CM Stalin
content: “Through full-body health check-ups and consultations with specialist doctors, health issues affecting several lakh people have been identified at an early stage and referred for appropriate advanced treatment,” says Tamil Nadu Chief Minister

title: Punjab, Haryana reel under intense cold; Hisar coldest 2.5 degrees Celsius
content: An intense cold wave continues to batter Punjab and Haryana, with low visibility due to dense fog likely to continue for next few days, says IMD

title: Decode Karnataka: Reflecting on what went down in 2025 and a wishlist for 2026
content: In this year ender episode of Decode Karnataka, an annual tradition of sorts, we take stock of the events and developments that made news in 2025.

title: Rowdy-sheeter externed from district
content: SP, District Collector Dr. A. Siri issued orders externing Tulasi Kumar from the district. Tulasi Kumar’s father, Vadde Ramanjaneyulu, and another rowdy-sheeter, Pathan Imran Khan, were also externed from the district a few days ago

title: Editors Council accuses section in Bangladesh's interim government of allowing violence
content: “We clearly know an announcement came to demolish the Prothom Alo, Daily Star, and the Chhyanat one or two days before the attacks. The people of the country know, and the government, as well, knows who gave the announcement,” says Editors Council President Nurul Kabir

title: How the Aravalli Hills formed and why they look the way they do
content: The Hills’ features are better understood as part of a belt of ancient rocks that many scholars have called the Aravalli-Delhi orogenic belt

title: Mann Ki Baat: PM Modi reflects on India’s milestones in 2025
content: ‘From national security to the sports field, from science laboratories to the world’s biggest platforms, India left a strong mark everywhere,’ Modi said during the year-ending ‘Mann Ki Baat’ episode

title: Digvijay's remark on X open dissent against Congress, Rahul dooming party: BJP
content: It's because our Narendra Modi is 'guddri ke lal' (diamond in the rough) and their leader is 'Jawahar ke lal' (great-grandson of Jawaharlal Nehru). Since our Narendra Modi has risen to top from bottom, he is taking the party (BJP) also to the top from bottom, says BJP national spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi

title: Congress celebrates 141st foundation day asserting it's role in Independence and nation building
content: Telangana Congress chief Mahesh Kumar Goud said the Congress was born out of the determination and sacrifices of great leaders and its contribution to India’s freedom struggle and post-Independence nation-building was unparalleled

title: Congress leaders pull up Pinarayi on Bengaluru demolition remark, but get rapped by AICC
content: AICC general secretary K.C. Venugopal chastised the Karnataka leaders on the clearance drive at Kogilu Layout.

title: PM Office directs Coal India to list all subsidiaries by 2030
content: The move aims to streamline governance, enhance transparency and unlock value through asset monetisation in the coal PSU

title: Henry up to 10th all time in rushing, Ravens win
content: Baltimore running back Derrick Henry moved into 10th place all time in NFL rushing yards Saturday night, finishing with 216, to go along with four touchdowns on the ground, as the Ravens produced a 41-24 win over the Green Bay Packers at Lambeau Field.

title: Bears clinch North title with GB loss; 1st since '18
content: The Chicago Bears locked up the NFC North on Saturday night at the conclusion of Green Bay's 41-24 loss to Baltimore.

title: Packers unsure on Week 18 QB after Willis shines
content: Packers coach Matt LaFleur was noncommittal about the team's starting quarterback for next weekend's regular-season finale after backup quarterback Malik Willis went 18-of-21 for 288 yards and a touchdown in Saturday's loss to the Ravens.

title: Slumping Lakers hold meeting, eye 'recalibration'
content: Lakers coach JJ Redick said Saturday was a day of "recalibration and reconnection" for slumping Los Angeles, which has lost three straight and six of 10.

title: Pels' Alvarado, Suns' Williams tossed after fight
content: Suns center Mark Williams and Pelicans point guard Jose Alvarado were ejected after getting into a fight in the third quarter Saturday night.

title: Team USA's Hutson struck by puck, out of hospital
content: Cole Hutson was briefly hospitalized after a puck appeared to strike him near the back of his helmet during Saturday's World Juniors game against Switzerland.

title: UVA sheds ACC title game loss, secures 11th win
content: Virginia quarterback Chandler Morris threw for 198 yards and the No. 20 Cavaliers, who lost in the ACC title game to Duke with a shot at the College Football Playoff on the line, outlasted 25th-ranked Missouri 13-7 in the Gator Bowl on Saturday night.

title: Giannis returns, draws Bulls' ire with late dunk
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo scored 29 points in his return from an eight-game absence Saturday night, punctuating the Milwaukee Bucks' 112-103 victory over the Chicago Bulls at United Center with a windmill dunk at the buzzer that drew the ire of the home team.

title: What you need to know for every NFL game in Week 17 -- including fantasy tips, playoff implications, predictions
content: Seahawks vs. Panthers. Jalen Hurts vs. Josh Allen. Picks, predictions and more for every remaining Week 17 game.

title: Week 17 inactives: Trouble at TE? What's the word on Fannin, Kincaid, Knox, Kittle?
content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

title: What's new heading into second season of TGL
content: From signature holes to a bigger and better putting green, the TGL is ready for the start of the 2026 season.

title: Why Raiders' Alex Bachman lives in a guesthouse and has no attachments
content: Alex Bachman once found his locker empty before game day. Now he lives by rentals and no attachments.

title: Ian Darke's Best XI: Who stands out halfway through the season?
content: Will it be Donnarumma or Raya for best goalkeeper? Which two Sunderland players are in? Here are the season's top players as we near the halfway point.

title: Despite leading the league, Arsenal haven't looked convincing
content: Arsenal relied on an own goal for the fourth-straight game and their win vs. Brighton saw them do just enough.

title: Most fashionable arrivals of NFL Week 17, featuring Roquan Smith
content: Before the NFL's Week 17 slate kicked off, players made sure to put their most fashionable foot forward.

title: Giants-Raiders loser could be big winner in NFL draft
content: There is a lot at stake for two 2-13 teams -- namely, the pole position for the No. 1 overall pick in the 2026 NFL draft.

title: Matthew Stafford vs. Drake Maye: Inside the odds, betting for the NFL's MVP race
content: Doug Greenberg goes inside the betting lines about the NFL MVP award, and Pamela Maldonado offers her best bet.

title: Tracking the NFL playoff picture: Updated chances to clinch open spots, win division titles
content: We are following the 2025 NFL season's playoff picture. Here's how things look right now for wild-card spots, division races and even the draft order.

title: A new United States champ; Three Stages of Hell for Rhodes vs. McIntyre
content: Friday's "SmackDown" saw a new champion being crowned and the Cody Rhodes-Drew McIntyre rivalry reaching a new level.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea eye Forest's England U21 star McAtee
content: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca wants to be reunited with former Manchester City midfielder James McAtee. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Kogilu Layout eviction: Congress leaders react strongly to Pinarayi’s remarks
content: Authorities had demolished houses after serving notices on residents who had illegally built them, but the officials had been directed to provide housing to them on humanitarian grounds, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah said.

title: Ukkadam-Athupalam flyover in Coimbatore to be named after former Union Minister C. Subramaniam: Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin said the announcement was being made following a request from educationist B.K. Krishnaraj Vanavarayar to propagate the legacy of Subramaniam’s illustrious contributions

title: Two arrested, arms and ammunition seized in Manipur
content: “One person, identified as Rebanta Kshetrimayum (49), was arrested from his house in the Pangei Lairam Mapan are,” says a police statement

title: Unnao rape case: SC to hear CBI's plea against HC order suspending Sengar's life sentence on December 29
content: According to the apex court's cause list for December 29, a Bench comprising Chief Justice Surya Kant and Justices J.K. Maheshwari and Augustine George Masih is slated to hear the plea

title: Nine UP men stranded in Kyrgyzstan after job fraud return to Pilibhit
content: Pilibhit District Magistrate Gyanendra Singh told PTI that the process for the return of the remaining three workers was almost complete, and they would be brought back before the year end

title: Pilot killed in paragliding accident in Himachal’s Bir Billing
content: According to officials of the Bir Billing Paragliding Association, the paraglider developed a technical malfunction shortly after take off, lost balance mid-air, and crashed near the road below the launch site.

title: Police, anti-mining protesters clash in Chhattisgarh’s Raigarh; many injured
content: The villagers have been staging a sit-in protest for the past fortnight in Daurabhatha village, opposing the coal block allotted to Jindal Steel in the Tamnar area

title: Had insightful discussions on governance, reforms at Chief Secretaries’ meeting: PM Modi
content: “Had insightful discussions on various issues relating to governance and reforms during the National Conference of Chief Secretaries being held in Delhi,” Mr. Modi said

title: Gangster dies of gunshot wounds in Uttarakhand; family alleges police connivance to grab property
content: Police said Tyagi was being taken from Roorkee jail to Laksar court for a hearing on Wednesday, when two bikers allegedly opened fire at the police vehicle near the Laksar flyover, and shot Tyagi.

title: Chennai scores well in terms of housing sales
content: The data also pointed out that Chennai added approximately 27,190 units in 2025, an annual increase of 30% against the previous year

title: Degrees of disillusionment in Tamil Nadu’s government colleges, universities
content: Judging by headlines alone, faculty members across government colleges and universities in Tamil Nadu have spent the better half of the past two years in upheaval over a plethora of issues that are yet to be resolved. A fair pay scale, timely promotions and clearance of pending increments, regularisation of the services of part-time and temporary employees, restoration of special pay provisions and revival of the old pension scheme are among their demands. Nahla Nainar explains the key issues plaguing higher education in the State

title: The new world of surrendered left-wing extremists
content: The lives of those involved in the Maoist movement remain largely hidden, shaped by a culture of secrecy. Satyasundar Barik speaks with several surrendered red-corridor workers, who describe how their lives have changed since giving up arms and what life inside the Maoist ranks truly looks like

title: Is the ‘health for all’ campaign on track?: Explained
content: What are India’s challenges on the health front? What does it need to do on funding? Why is there a growing resistance to antibiotics? Why did India fail to reach its goals on ending tuberculosis? What does the pharmaceutical industry need to do on quality control?

title: FSSAI tightens testing norms for packaged water, drops BIS mandate
content: Regulator devises scheme for testing packaged drinking water and mineral water; directs manufacturers to comply with it from January 1; consumer groups urge authorities to ensure periodic inspections at plants and shut unauthorised units

title: What are India’s diplomatic headwinds in 2026?: Explained
content: Why has foreign policy in 2025 been full of ‘shock and surprise’? Where does India stand in its ties with the U.S.? Will issues over tariffs, visas, immigration persist in the new year? How troubling is the neighbourhood turmoil, particularly in Pakistan and Bangladesh?

title: V.V. Rajesh: Saffron entry
content: The BJP, which won its first Corporation election in Kerala, has chosen a familiar local face to be the Mayor of Thiruvananthapuram

title: Parties, public cry foul as SIR drive excludes lakhs of voters in Kerala
content: As debate rages over the reported exclusion of around 24 lakh voters from the draft voters’ list of Kerala, after the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral rolls, Tiki Rajwi takes a closer look at the process to understand the concerns raised by both voters and political parties.

title: M.P. Congress media head quits amid discontent rumours; party declines resignation
content: As per party insiders, Mr. Nayak, a former State Cabinet Minister, is believed to be upset after a 13-member talent hunt committee appointed by him was cancelled by MPCC general secretary (media and communication)

title: Supreme Court Special Bench to hear suo motu case on ‘definition’ of Aravalli
content: A three-judge Special Vacation Bench headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant will hear the matter.

title: Bihar BJP President Saraogi meets Shah and Nadda in Delhi
content: It was Mr. Saraogi’s first meeting with Mr. Shah and Mr. Nadda after being appointed as state president earlier this month. He also met Bihar in-charge Vinod Tawde.

title: Tharoor criticises Thiruvananthapuram’s omission from Railway’s ’Vision 2030’, writes to Centre
content: The MP highlights the city’s strategic and operational prominence within the Southern Railway network in letter to Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Presidents, vice-presidents elected to panchayats across Kerala
content: The Congress-led United Democratic Front and the CPI(M)-led Left Democratic Front win control of seven district panchayats each. In some of the hung panchayats, parties such as the Social Democratic Party of India, Welfare Party and Twenty20 extend support to candidates of major alliances in the election of presidents and vice-presidents

title: T.N.’s growth under DMK government has drawn nation’s attention: Stalin
content: Even Union Ministers are spreading hatred against the State as they could not tolerate its growth; they believe they can secure votes in northern States by targeting Tamil Nadu, says Chief Minister

title: Congress shedding crocodile tears on rural jobs scheme: Chouhan
content: It used Mahatma Gandhi’s name for electoral gains, reduced the budget for MGNREGA and froze wages, alleges Agriculture Minister

title: The Hindu Impact: Minister seeks report on Wildlife First objections to KIOCL forest clearance plea
content: The directive follows a report published by The Hindu on December 24, 2025, which highlighted Wildlife First’s appeal to the Karnataka government to reject KIOCL’s application for retrospective forest clearance.

title: Looking back 2025: The Hindu’s most viewed cartoons
content: A collection of cartoons from The Hindu addressing key political events and controversies in India and abroad from 2025

title: Harassment of Kashmiris in other states is matter of national security: Sajad Lone
content: Mr. Lone urged Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and Chief Minister Omar Abdullah to intervene in the matter

title: Bangladesh participation uncertain in Kolkata International Book Fair amid clearance issue
content: Publishers and Booksellers Guild say they cannot offer or allot stalls to publishers from Bangladesh until MEA clearance

title: Mann Ki Baat: PM Modi highlights India's achievement in 2025 - key quotes
content: 'Operation Sindoor' became a symbol of pride for every Indian . the world clearly saw that today's Bharat does not compromise on its security . 2025 was also a memorable year in terms of sports .

title: Record flights, major disasters: 2025 exposed cracks in aviation's epic rebound
content: International travel remains the main engine of growth, but to sustain air travel demand globally, regulators must foster policies and frameworks that enable improved connectivity, long-term resilience, and sustainable growth.

title: ‘Wrongfully dismissed’: Indian man wins case against KFC outlet superior in UK; to get £70k

title: A tale of two Decembers - How Bangladesh is back where it started
content: Muhammad Ali Jinnah's declaration of "State language of Pakistan..." in 1952, police opened fire on student demonstrators in Dhaka, killing several . a theme that would return decades later led to the ouster of sheikh Hasina, the daughter of Bangladesh's ffl .

title: Tarique Rahman In Bangladesh: How His Father Was Assassinated 40 Years Ago
content: Surrounded by security, Tarique Rahman placed wreaths, offered prayers, and remained silent for several moments at his father Ziaur Rahman's grave.

title: Schoolgirl Uniforms, Sex Toys: What Jeffrey Epstein Bought Online
content: A set of 1,006 Amazon email receipts belonging to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, spanning five years, has been made public by the US Department of Justice.

title: "Kidney-Touching Acting": Pak Cop Trolled Over 'Murder Case Call' On Podcast
content: Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) Shehrbano Naqvi of Lahore was seen taking a phone call mid-interview and returning an hour later, having handled the case.

title: "Oppose Their Ideology": Digvijaya Singh Clarifies Amid "RSS-BJP" Post Row
content: Congress MP Digvijaya Singh reiterated that he opposes the RSS and BJP's ideology, a day after an image he shared lauding Prime Minister Narendra Modi's rise through organisational ranks sparked rumours of a crisis within the Congress.

title: "Invader": US Influencer Mocks Indian-Origin Man Who Died In Canada Hospital
content: A US influencer is under fire for mocking the death of an Indian-origin man who waited over eight hours for treatment at a hospital in Canada.

title: Propaganda Debunked, Bangladesh Still Tries To Pin Murder On India
content: The police in Bangladesh have again alleged the two key suspects in the murder of radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi fled to Meghalaya in the northeast.

title: Pak President Admits He Was Advised To Move To Bunkers During Op Sindoor
content: Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari has admitted that his military secretary had advised him to move to a bunker during the four-day conflict with India in May. However, he had declined that advice, he told a public gathering on Saturday.

title: 80 Years Later, US Made 470-Kg WWII Bomb Removed In Serbia's Capital
content: A 470-kilogram (1,000-pound) World War II aerial bomb was safely removed on Sunday from a construction site in a central district of Serbia's capital, Belgrade, police said.

title: Elon Musk Reacts To Indian-Origin Man's Death After 8-Hour Wait In Hospital
content: Space and tech billionaire Elon Musk on Friday slammed the Canadian healthcare system following the death of a 44-year-old Indian-origin man, who died while waiting for over eight hours for medical attention.

title: Married Man Sexually Exploits Live-In Partner, Siphons 20 Lakhs In Bengaluru
content: Police in Bengaluru's Bagalgunte arrested a 29-year-old man on charges of alleged cheating, sexual exploitation and theft after duping a woman under the guise of a romantic relationship.

title: Humayun Kabir's Son Detained For Slapping On-Duty Cop In Father's Security
content: JUP (Janata Unnayan Party) chairperson Humayun Kabir's son, Gulam Nabi Azad, has been detained for assaulting an on-duty policeman.

title: Bangladesh's Ex-PM Khaleda Zia In "Extremely Critical" Condition, Says Doctor
content: Bangladesh's former prime minister Khaleda Zia is in an "extremely critical" condition, her personal physician has said.Zia  has been undergoing treatment at Dhaka's Evercare Hospital since November 23.

title: Zepto Files Confidential IPO Papers With SEBI, Eyes Rs 11,000 Crore Via Issue
content: Zepto has filed preliminary papers with markets regulator Sebi to raise Rs 11,000 crore through its initial public offering using a confidential route, people familiar with the development said.

title: Kennedy Centre Demands $1 Million After Musician Cancels Show Over Trump Name
content: The president of the Kennedy Center fiercely criticised a musician's sudden decision to cancel a Christmas Eve performance at the venue days after the White House announced that President Donald Trump's name would be added to the facility.

title: National Conference MP Among Leaders Under House Arrest Over Reservation Protest
content: Protests were planned against the Chief Minister Omar Abdullah-led government, demanding rationalisation of the reservation policy in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Congress Meltdown: In Digvijaya Singh's 'RSS' Post, A Reckoning For Rahul
content: From the row between Siddaramaiah and DK Shivakumar in Karnataka, to the sidelining of leaders like Shashi Tharoor and Manish Tewari, to replacing the leadership in Rajasthan, Gandhi can no longer continue evading responsibility.

title: Winter Storm Snarls Holiday Travel Across US Northeast, Great Lakes
content: More than a thousand flights were canceled or delayed across the Northeast and Great Lakes regions due to snow as thousands took to roads and airports during the busy travel period between Christmas and New Year's.

title: Paris Metro Stabbings Suspect Moved To Psychiatric Hospital
content: The suspect in the stabbing of three women in the Paris metro has been released from custody and moved to a psychiatric hospital, prosecutors said.

title: Gautam Adani Unveils AI Centre In Baramati, Says Youth Must Lead Age Of Intelligence
content: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Sunday said that India is entering a decisive phase where technology, talent, and national purpose must move together and urged the next generation to rise and lead the age of artificial intelligence.

title: NFL playoff-clinching scenarios: What's at stake for nine teams in Week 17?
content: eight more teams punched their ticket into the postseason during week 16 of 2025 . 10 of 14 teams have qualified for the playoffs with two weeks to go . five AFC teams and four NFC teams have a chance to secure something this week .

title: Why Laveranues Coles decided to give up his cushy retired life to become an officer
content: laveranues Coles was approached by an elderly woman, a shopper walking to her car . she had no idea he was one of the NFL's most productive wide receivers from 2000 to 2009 . "i feel safe with you here," she told Coles .

title: Where did the Staubach-Pearson 'Hail Mary' football end up after 50 years?
content: the cowboys beat the Vikings in their 1975 playoff game . a quarterback catches the "Hail Mary" pass from Roger Staubach . "your heart wants to believe everything you see is real, so you've got to be careful," says Adams .

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks for Week 17
content: this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS . the weekly Shadow Reports: WR vs. CB Cheat Sheet .

title: Grading coaching hires: Kyle Whittingham, Michigan agree to deal
content: the wildest college football coaching cycle -- perhaps ever -- has reached the hiring phase . watch your favorite events in the newly enhanced ESPN App . sign up now New hires always come with hope and optimism, grand proclamations and the chance to get programs on right track .

title: 💰 The NFL players chasing millions in bonuses
content: if the Steelers make the playoffs, Aaron Rodgers would make an extra $500,000. A Pittsburgh wild-card win would earn him another $600,000. A divisional round win? rodgers gets another $750,000. the money only grows as the stakes get higher .

title: Ravens' Derrick Henry rushes for 216 yards in win over Packers
content: the Texans beat the Chargers to clinch a third consecutive playoff berth for the first time in franchise history . the game began on christmas day with an NFC East showdown between the Cowboys and the Commanders . Dallas jumped all over Washington early but had to hold on after giving up several big plays .
